page.title: 10Tourism- Butterton & Onecote
page.content: Tourists come to Butterton from various parts ot the country. They make the local business boom in lots of ways. They buy food and drink from the local pub - The Black Lion. When tourists come they stay either at The Black Lion or camp on farmland. The comments made about the village are very favourable. There are a few Guesthouses and some self-catering accommodation in Onecote. Each place can cater for between 4 and 6 people. Most of the tourists who stay in Oncote come from the south of the country. Very few people come to stay from the north of England or Scotland. Most of the tourist accommodation opens from March to October but the self-catering places allow long-staying guests during the winter months. The busiest months are July to September.
